title: [Self-Directed] Practical Application of Deep Learning-Based Speech Enhancement Technology: Improving Communication in Social Contexts and Strengthening Cultural Relationships

context.prior_knowledge: Basic signal processing, understanding of deep learning model architectures, Python programming proficiency, and foundational awareness of social communication contexts and cultural diversity
context.additional_context: Strengthens competencies in designing and optimizing lightweight deep learning models for practitioners to address real-world environmental noise issues: Technical approaches for solving community noise problems, mitigating communication barriers across social classes and cultural backgrounds, developing low-cost solutions to bridge technological gaps, and citizen-led technology dissemination.

learning_goals: Performing STFT-based speech signal spectrogram analysis and visualization: establishing acoustic foundations for improving social communication and reflecting cultural contexts.
Understanding the LMResUnet++ model architecture and implementing a multi-scale information processing mechanism: optimizing speech quality across diverse social environments and hierarchical groups.

Designing a hyperparameter optimization process using the Aquila Black Widow Optimization (ABWO) algorithm: efficient model development in resource-constrained environments and bridging technological gaps.

Learners can evaluate three or more speech samples using the PESSQ (Perceptual Evaluation of Speech Quality) metric, write a comparative analysis report including correlation analysis with MOS (Mean Opinion Score) within two weeks: establishing a speech quality evaluation system for measuring social trust and designing a citizen-participatory evaluation framework.

Within three weeks, learners can develop a speech enhancement system prototype executable on personal devices like Raspberry Pi 4 and submit experimental results measuring performance improved by an SNR (Signal-to-Noise Ratio) of 5 dB or higher: implementing accessible technology solutions for community problem-solving and supporting economically disadvantaged groups.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
